name: Emma Whatley
text: I know the staff and have seen the work they do, its amazing and helps so many people

name: Scott Hattis
text:
Place is terrible. They search you and your bags nightly. You are not allowed to have any type of food on your person, or bags.... they kicked someone out because they had a single paper packet of pepper!!! (No lie)

I was kicked out because I had a granola bar in my backpack. Common!!!

The food that is fed is soup made with canned succotash and beans, but the programmers get to eat good food right in front of everyone else.

If you donate good food, it will not be served to the homeless, it will be given to the programmers. Programmers are those whom are felons court ordered to undergo the salvation army's drug program.

these people are ridiculous!!

name: Richard Johnson
text: very nice to help the homeless and feed the hungry

name: Keith Stinnett
text: I love it here, I felt so safe and secure, it gave me structure and stability and allowed me to save up some money, but I'm having to dip into my account to pay for the motel, I wish I could come back until I get enough saved up to get my own place, I'm willing to pay for lodging

name: Leopold Spencer
text: Wow! Bag tossing fools! Great service to a community patron with great potential! Now I have to start over again with NO CLOTHING to show myself approved! Great lesson! They certainly have material handling down pat!

name: Joshua Webb
text: Food is A1 and not nasty like Downtowns. The tea is marvelous. They bought me an entire set of nice clothes. I had a great experience for being homeless.

name: Barbara Davis
text: I love the fact that when I needed a place to stay I could go sign in there at night get a hot shower a warm bed to sleep in. Wake up get a free breakfast and go about my day. And if I needed any further assistance all I would have to do is go to the administrator's office.

name: JEFF DICKEY
text: Thank you for all your help.

name: WJ F
text: It's a decent place nothing like Chicago Huntsville looks like Dirt cat litter

name: Deric Conner
text: It's small but at least they make them bathe

name: Olen Smith
text: A port in the storm of life

name: Zack Prater
text: They don't take pets, no matter how small, unless they are service animals.

resp.text: The tornado shelter policies and rules are established by the Triana Town Council. For liability and safety reasons pets are not allowed in the shelter regardless of size for a variety of reasons to include: allergies of other shelter patrons, size constraints, possible temperament issues of pets when exposed to noise (e.g. the tornado siren outside the door, or exhaust fan) or other unfamiliar pets or people.  Legitimate service animals are permitted.  If sheltering with your pet is a priority, please visit one of the local news organizations websites that list shelters in the area and find a shelter that accepts pets so you can shelter with them when the next event occurs.
